communications.subject: Arizona Public Records Law Request: Arizona DOC transgender policies
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arizona Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

All department policy and guidance documents regarding transgender inmates, including but not limited to gender-affirming medical care, housing and treatment by staff. I also request records of any proposed and/or enacted changes to said policies made on or after Nov. 6, 2024 until date of search, if such documents exist.

I request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Ileana Garnand

Sincerely,

Ileana Garnand

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Ohio Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

All documentation submitted to the U.S. Department of Education's Student Privacy Policy Office in response to the office's March 28, 2025, request for records such as "'reports, information on policies and procedures, annual notifications, training materials or other information necessary' to provide assurance that the SEA and their respective LEAs are complying with the provisions of FERPA and PPRA".

I have attached a copy of the SPPO's request letter for reference. The relevant section is found on the last page, under "Assurance of Compliance". The SPPO requested the documentation be submitted no later than April 30, 2025. If the Ohio Department of Education sent communications to the SPPO requesting an extension or declining to submit the documentation, I request a copy of said communications.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Evergreen Solutions (Jefferson Community College)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:


Subject: Request for Public Records - 

Greetings,

I hope this email finds you well. We at Evergreen Solutions, LLC, are conducting a compensation study on behalf of our client and I am writing to make a formal open records request. We are requesting an electronic copy of your staff and faculty (if applicable) database as well as relevant documents such as job descriptions, collective bargaining agreements, and pay plans. I am able to send survey templates to assist with the data collection; however, we will accept data in the manner most convenient for you.

Staff Census Information requested:

Job Titles
Classification Title
Pay Grades
Pay Ranges (Minimum and Maximum)
Actual Salaries
Full-Time Equivalent (FTE) Status
Staff Handbook

I also kindly request answers to the following questions related to the compensation study:

How are salaries adjusted for your organization (e.g., COLA, Longevity, performance, etc.)?
What is your current turnover rate?
What is your current average tenure for an employee?
Date your current compensation plan was implemented.
Date of the last salary adjustment?
How frequently are job descriptions updated?

For the faculty database, I am requesting the following information:

Faculty Census:
Rank (if applicable)
Classification Title (if faculty holds other positions other than teaching such as Dean, Chair, Coordinators,etc)
Highest Degree Held
Pay Grade
Pay Ranges (Min& Max)
Current Step (if on a step plan)
Contract Length (in days and/or months)
Annual Base Salary with no additives
Annual Salary with any additives
Discipline (Not to be confused with department, the distinct/specific subject the faculty member teaches; Ex: Microbiology)
Department
CIP Code (if available - by individual incumbent)

Additionally, copies of the following documents, if available:

Copy of all faculty pay plans
Employee Benefit Information (Holidays Off, Health Insurance, Etc)
Salary Adjustment Policy (Longevity, performance, COLA, etc)
Any Collective Bargaining Agreements
Current Turnover Rate
Current Average Tenure
Date that your current pay plan was implemented
Date of your last salary adjustment to pay plan
How frequently are your job descriptions updated
Do you have a planned salary adjustment to your compensation structures for the next fiscal year? If so, by what amount?
Please list/attach and supplements/additives that faculty are compensated for duties outside of instruction
Faculty Handbooks
Adjunct Rates/Pay Plan
Overload Rates
Rates for compensation for faculty leadership- Deans, Coordinators, Department Chairs
Do you compensate faculty differently based on area of discipline? If yes, please provide details.
Do you have any form of additional compensation for Large Class Size? If yes, please provide details.
Do you have an education incentive at your institution? If yes, please provide details.

I understand that public records requests may involve administrative processes and associated fees, as allowed by law. Please inform me of any fees and the estimated timeframe for fulfilling this request. If any portion of this request is denied, please provide a written explanation for the denial, citing the specific legal grounds for the refusal.

Please consider this email as a formal request for public records under the applicable open records laws. If there are any questions or additional details needed to process this request, please do not hesitate to contact me.

I look forward to your prompt attention to this matter and the timely provision of the requested information. Your cooperation in ensuring transparency and access to public records is greatly appreciated.

Do you agree to the redaction of information that is subject to mandatory exceptions, provided such redactions are clearly labeled on information you receive?: Yes
Do you agree to the redaction of information that is subject to discretionary exceptions, provided such redactions are clearly labeled on information you receive? Yes

Email: alisia@consultevergreen.com

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alisia Rios

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Government employee salary data (Department of Veterans Affairs - Office of Deputy Assistant Secretary for Human Resources Management)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of the most recent database maintained by this agency detailing compensation and occupation details for individuals in the employ of this agency.

Please provide, if possible, the following pieces of information for each employee: 

• Name of Employee
• Unique ID (if applicable)
• Age
• Gender
• Ethnicity
• Job Title or Position
• Organizational Unit
• Location
• Regular Wages
• Overtime Pay
• Other Pay
• Benefits
• Total Compensation

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Beryl Lipton

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL] RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: Government employee salary data (Department of Veterans Affairs - Office of Deputy Assistant Secretary for Human Resources Management)
communications.communication:
Good morning,

The information you are seeking is publicly available at the following links:

https://vapal.efoia-host.com/app/ReadingRoom.aspx

https://www.fedsdatacenter.com/federal-pay-rates/index.php?y=2024&n=&l=&a=DEPARTMENT+OF+VETERANS+AFFAIRS&o=

This concludes the FOIA Service’s response. We appreciate your interest in the VA.

Thank you,

VA FOIA Service
Compliance, Risk and Remediation (CRR)
Office of Information and Technology (OI&T)
U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs
E-Fax: 202-632-7581
Vacofoiase@va.gov<mailto:Vacofoiase@va.gov>

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Boulton Official Calendar
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any work calendars, official schedules or itineraries for Caroline Boulton. This request seeks records produced since January 1, 2018.

I am a reporter with The Guardian and other outlets.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jimmy Tobias

title: Field Interview Cards (Santa Ana Police Department)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Field Interview Cards (Santa Ana Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Hello, 

I am requesting copies of blank field interview cards or equivalent forms filled out during a police stop. Search 2018 to 2024, if there have been no changes since 2018 to the cards, then that year is sufficient. 

Thank you

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joey Scott

communications.subject: Your City of Santa Ana public records request #25-1022 has been submitted.
communications.communication:
City of Santa Ana ************************************************************************ Your record request #25-1022 has been submitted successfully. This will acknowledge that the City of Santa Ana received your Public Records Act request. The City will respond to your request within ten (10) days of receipt of this request in accordance with the California Public Records Act. Pursuant to the Email and Text Message Retention Policy of the City, all emails and text messages are retained for two (2) years and deleted on a rolling basis thereafter. Please be advised, Public Records Requests are only reviewed during regular business hours, from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. Monday through Thursday and alternating Fridays.  Visit the online Holiday and Closed Friday Schedule at https://www.santa-ana.org/holiday-and-closed-friday-schedule ************************************************************************ Reply to this email or sign in to contact City of Santa Ana.

Change your email settings | Visit our help center

communications.subject: Kentucky Open Records Act Request: Kentucky DOC transgender policies
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Kentucky Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All department policy and guidance documents regarding transgender inmates, including but not limited to gender-affirming medical care, housing and treatment by staff. I also request records of any proposed and/or enacted changes to said policies made on or after Nov. 6, 2024 until date of search, if such documents exist.

I request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ileana Garnand

communications.subject: Ohio Open Records Law Request: 2015 Crime Incidents Request (Cleveland Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Ohio Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting data on crime incidents—those classified by your agency as crimes—rather than calls for service or unfounded incidents.
• Year(s) Requested: 2015
• Columns Requested: Incident date, Incident time, Type of crime (e.g., robbery, theft, etc.), Incident ID, and all other available columns that do not require additional processing by the agency or redaction.

If the data are stored in a proprietary or custom electronic format not publicly available, I request that it be converted to a format viewable with standard software, such as Microsoft Excel or CSV. Please avoid providing data in PDF or paper printouts.

This request is made to support academic research conducted in the public interest and is not for commercial purposes. The data will contribute to a research project assessing the effect of music concerts on crime, aiming to enhance public understanding of how large events influence community safety.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Kristina Block

title: California Public Record Act Request - WIC § 851.1 Compliance (Kings County Probation Department)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: California Public Record Act Request - WIC § 851.1 Compliance (Kings County Probation Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:
This letter constitutes a request under the California Public Records Act (CPRA) to the  Kings County Probation Department  from the Electronic Frontier Foundation (EFF) for records related to AB 2448 (CA Welf & Inst Code § 851.1. Online:  https://codes.findlaw.com/ca/welfare-and-institutions-code/wic-sect-851-1/), a 2018 law that requires juvenile detention facilities to provide youth in custody with internet access.

Specifically, this law establishes the following requirements for juvenile detention facilities: 

“Minors detained in or committed to a juvenile hall shall be provided with access to computer technology and the Internet for the purposes of education.”

The law also allows juvenile halls to provide access to computers and the internet for “maintaining relationships with family.” The Chief Probation Officer, or their designee, may “limit or deny access to computer technology or the Internet for safety and security or staffing reasons.”

We request the following Kings County Probation Department records: 

1. All policies, procedures, practices, manuals, memorandums, orders or related documents that discuss providing minors in juvenile hall with access to computer technology and the internet for educational purposes; 
2. All policies, procedures, practices, manuals, memorandums, orders or related documents that discuss providing minors in juvenile hall with access to computer technology and the internet for maintaining familial relationships; 
3. All handbooks or similar documents provided to teachers and other instructors that describe the process, rules, and guidelines for accessing computer technology and the internet in juvenile hall; 
4. All handbooks or similar documents provided to minors in juvenile hall that describe the process, rules, and guidelines for accessing computer technology and the internet; 
5. All procurement records, such as RFPs, RFIs, solicitations, successful bids, and contracts/agreements with vendors for technology systems to provide minors in juvenile hall with access to computing and internet-connected technology; 
6. Examples of any consent, permission, and similar documents provided to parents and guardians of minors in juvenile hall related to access to computer technology and the internet;
7. Any quarterly, annual, or other periodic reports that summarize the implementation of programs to comply with AB 2448 generated since 2018;
8. Logs, records, or orders related to suspension of internet access, for any amount of time, “for safety and security or staffing reasons” since 2018; and
9. Aggregate data on the number of juvenile users of computer technology and internet systems for the period 2022 and 2023.

Should these records not exist, we would appreciate a statement as to whether the agency is in compliance with AB 2448. 

In addition, we request the following information and assistance, as required under CPRA: 
- Assistance in identifying additional records and information that will assist us in understanding the state of the agency’s compliance with AB 2448;
- A description of the information technology and physical location in which the records exist; and
- Suggestions for overcoming any practical basis for denying access to the records and information sought. 

The CPRA also requires you to undertake reasonable efforts to locate responsive records and to work in good faith with requesters to respond to their request. See CYAC v. City of National City, 220 Cal.App.4th 1385, 1430 (2013). Thus under the CPRA you are obligated to conduct a reasonable search and cannot deny a request merely because it might generate a large volume of records.

We ask that you please respond to this request within 10 days either by providing all the requested records or by providing a written response setting forth the legal authority on which you rely in withholding or redacting any document, as well as stating when documents will be made available.
 
We also request that any records maintained in an electronic format be provided in that same format (such as a PDF, CSV or XLS file), to avoid copying costs. 

However, should you be unable to do so, EFF will reimburse you for the direct costs of copying these records (if you elect to charge for copying) plus postage. If you anticipate that these costs will exceed $50.00, or that the time needed to copy the records will delay their release, please contact me so that I can arrange to inspect the documents or decide which documents I wish to have copied. Please also provide an invoice and a cost breakdown of the fee estimate. If the fees are less than $50.00, please copy and send the records and invoice as soon as possible, and we will promptly pay the required costs.

Thank you for your consideration of this request. If you have any questions or concerns, or if I can provide any clarification that will help identify responsive documents or focus this request, please do not hesitate to contact me at the Muckrock.com email above or my direct email, dm@eff.org. You may also mail correspondence to the Electronic Frontier Foundation, 815 Eddy St. San Francisco, CA, 94109, or leave a voicemail message at 415-436-9333 x151.                                          
Sincerely,
Dave Maass
Director of Investigations
Electronic Frontier Foundation

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Bilingual language capabilities of MA DCF social workers
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting a listing for each DCF office detailing the language capabilities of the workers in that office.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Mx. Erika Shira, LMHC, MT-BC

communications.communication:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

all incident reports that happened on march 2025

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Martin Brooks

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Irvine Police Department Cybertruck
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any documents pertaining to the purchase, use, repairs, complaints, accidents, and modifications made to the Tesla Cybertruck currently being used by the Irvine Police Department.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

A. Nonymous

communications.subject: Ohio Open Records Law Request: Ohio DOC transgender policies
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Ohio Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

All department policy and guidance documents regarding transgender inmates, including but not limited to gender-affirming medical care, housing and treatment by staff. I also request records of any proposed and/or enacted changes to said policies made on or after Nov. 6, 2024 until date of search, if such documents exist.

I request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Ileana Garnand

title: Evergreen Solutions (West Genesee Central School District Office)

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Evergreen Solutions (West Genesee Central School District Office)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:


Subject: Request for Public Records - 

Greetings,

I hope this email finds you well. We at Evergreen Solutions, LLC, are conducting a compensation study on behalf of our client and I am writing to make a formal open records request. We are requesting an electronic copy of your staff and faculty (if applicable) database as well as relevant documents such as job descriptions, collective bargaining agreements, and pay plans. I am able to send survey templates to assist with the data collection; however, we will accept data in the manner most convenient for you.

Staff Census Information requested:

Job Titles
Classification Title
Pay Grades
Pay Ranges (Minimum and Maximum)
Actual Salaries
Full-Time Equivalent (FTE) Status
Staff Handbook

I also kindly request answers to the following questions related to the compensation study:

How are salaries adjusted for your organization (e.g., COLA, Longevity, performance, etc.)?
What is your current turnover rate?
What is your current average tenure for an employee?
Date your current compensation plan was implemented.
Date of the last salary adjustment?
How frequently are job descriptions updated?

For the faculty database, I am requesting the following information:

Faculty Census:
Rank (if applicable)
Classification Title (if faculty holds other positions other than teaching such as Dean, Chair, Coordinators,etc)
Highest Degree Held
Pay Grade
Pay Ranges (Min& Max)
Current Step (if on a step plan)
Contract Length (in days and/or months)
Annual Base Salary with no additives
Annual Salary with any additives
Discipline (Not to be confused with department, the distinct/specific subject the faculty member teaches; Ex: Microbiology)
Department
CIP Code (if available - by individual incumbent)

Additionally, copies of the following documents, if available:

Copy of all faculty pay plans
Employee Benefit Information (Holidays Off, Health Insurance, Etc)
Salary Adjustment Policy (Longevity, performance, COLA, etc)
Any Collective Bargaining Agreements
Current Turnover Rate
Current Average Tenure
Date that your current pay plan was implemented
Date of your last salary adjustment to pay plan
How frequently are your job descriptions updated
Do you have a planned salary adjustment to your compensation structures for the next fiscal year? If so, by what amount?
Please list/attach and supplements/additives that faculty are compensated for duties outside of instruction
Faculty Handbooks
Adjunct Rates/Pay Plan
Overload Rates
Rates for compensation for faculty leadership- Deans, Coordinators, Department Chairs
Do you compensate faculty differently based on area of discipline? If yes, please provide details.
Do you have any form of additional compensation for Large Class Size? If yes, please provide details.
Do you have an education incentive at your institution? If yes, please provide details.

I understand that public records requests may involve administrative processes and associated fees, as allowed by law. Please inform me of any fees and the estimated timeframe for fulfilling this request. If any portion of this request is denied, please provide a written explanation for the denial, citing the specific legal grounds for the refusal.

Please consider this email as a formal request for public records under the applicable open records laws. If there are any questions or additional details needed to process this request, please do not hesitate to contact me.

I look forward to your prompt attention to this matter and the timely provision of the requested information. Your cooperation in ensuring transparency and access to public records is greatly appreciated.

Do you agree to the redaction of information that is subject to mandatory exceptions, provided such redactions are clearly labeled on information you receive?: Yes
Do you agree to the redaction of information that is subject to discretionary exceptions, provided such redactions are clearly labeled on information you receive? Yes

Email: alisia@consultevergreen.com

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alisia Rios

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Field Interview Cards (San Diego Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Hello, 

I am requesting copies of blank field interview cards or equivalent forms filled out during a police stop. Search 2018 to 2024, if there have been no changes since 2018 to the cards, then that year is sufficient. 

Thank you

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joey Scott

communications.communication:

Pursuant to the West Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

With respect to Executive Order 3-25 (referring to "DEI"), a copy of any response provided to the Office of the Governor by or pertaining to a university, college, or other institution of higher education, as required by Section 2(b) of the Executive Order.

The Executive Order is available at https://apps.sos.wv.gov/adlaw/executivejournal/readpdf.aspx?DocID=97521.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

communications.subject: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: New Mexico DOC transgender policies
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All department policy and guidance documents regarding transgender inmates, including but not limited to gender-affirming medical care, housing and treatment by staff. I also request records of any proposed and/or enacted changes to said policies made on or after Nov. 6, 2024 until date of search, if such documents exist.

I request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ileana Garnand

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Evergreen Solutions (Onondaga Central School District)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:


Subject: Request for Public Records - 

Greetings,

I hope this email finds you well. We at Evergreen Solutions, LLC, are conducting a compensation study on behalf of our client and I am writing to make a formal open records request. We are requesting an electronic copy of your staff and faculty (if applicable) database as well as relevant documents such as job descriptions, collective bargaining agreements, and pay plans. I am able to send survey templates to assist with the data collection; however, we will accept data in the manner most convenient for you.

Staff Census Information requested:

Job Titles
Classification Title
Pay Grades
Pay Ranges (Minimum and Maximum)
Actual Salaries
Full-Time Equivalent (FTE) Status
Staff Handbook

I also kindly request answers to the following questions related to the compensation study:

How are salaries adjusted for your organization (e.g., COLA, Longevity, performance, etc.)?
What is your current turnover rate?
What is your current average tenure for an employee?
Date your current compensation plan was implemented.
Date of the last salary adjustment?
How frequently are job descriptions updated?

For the faculty database, I am requesting the following information:

Faculty Census:
Rank (if applicable)
Classification Title (if faculty holds other positions other than teaching such as Dean, Chair, Coordinators,etc)
Highest Degree Held
Pay Grade
Pay Ranges (Min& Max)
Current Step (if on a step plan)
Contract Length (in days and/or months)
Annual Base Salary with no additives
Annual Salary with any additives
Discipline (Not to be confused with department, the distinct/specific subject the faculty member teaches; Ex: Microbiology)
Department
CIP Code (if available - by individual incumbent)

Additionally, copies of the following documents, if available:

Copy of all faculty pay plans
Employee Benefit Information (Holidays Off, Health Insurance, Etc)
Salary Adjustment Policy (Longevity, performance, COLA, etc)
Any Collective Bargaining Agreements
Current Turnover Rate
Current Average Tenure
Date that your current pay plan was implemented
Date of your last salary adjustment to pay plan
How frequently are your job descriptions updated
Do you have a planned salary adjustment to your compensation structures for the next fiscal year? If so, by what amount?
Please list/attach and supplements/additives that faculty are compensated for duties outside of instruction
Faculty Handbooks
Adjunct Rates/Pay Plan
Overload Rates
Rates for compensation for faculty leadership- Deans, Coordinators, Department Chairs
Do you compensate faculty differently based on area of discipline? If yes, please provide details.
Do you have any form of additional compensation for Large Class Size? If yes, please provide details.
Do you have an education incentive at your institution? If yes, please provide details.

I understand that public records requests may involve administrative processes and associated fees, as allowed by law. Please inform me of any fees and the estimated timeframe for fulfilling this request. If any portion of this request is denied, please provide a written explanation for the denial, citing the specific legal grounds for the refusal.

Please consider this email as a formal request for public records under the applicable open records laws. If there are any questions or additional details needed to process this request, please do not hesitate to contact me.

I look forward to your prompt attention to this matter and the timely provision of the requested information. Your cooperation in ensuring transparency and access to public records is greatly appreciated.

Do you agree to the redaction of information that is subject to mandatory exceptions, provided such redactions are clearly labeled on information you receive?: Yes
Do you agree to the redaction of information that is subject to discretionary exceptions, provided such redactions are clearly labeled on information you receive? Yes

Email: alisia@consultevergreen.com

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alisia Rios

This will acknowledge receipt of your request for records under the Freedom of Information Law received by the Division of Criminal Justice Services on March 22, 2024. The request was for "All applications for grants submitted to DCJS by the Schenectady Police Department between January 1, 2010 and the present."



Your request has been forwarded to the appropriate program area(s) to identify documents that are responsive to your request and which may be made available pursuant to all applicable provisions of the Freedom of Information Law.



A determination as to whether your request is granted or denied will be reached in approximately 20 business days or we will notify you in writing if the responsible program area(s) should require additional time to locate, assemble and review documents that may be responsive to your request.



Please note that, pursuant to Article 6 of the Public Officers Law, a charge may be applied to your request, including the actual cost of the medium used to respond to your Freedom of Information Law request and/or other related costs.  When responsive records have been identified, you will be informed of any cost and how payment should be made.







Very truly yours,


Brian Garvey, Esq.
Records Access Officer

communications.subject: FW: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Schenectady PD Grant Applications
communications.communication:
Dear Chris Gelardi:

This is in response to your Freedom of Information Law (FOIL) request for "All applications for grants submitted to DCJS by the Schenectady Police Department between January 1, 2010 and the present."

Please find links to 2 PDF documents below that are responsive to your request. Please note that pursuant to Sections 87(2)(b) and 87(2)(e)(iv) of the Public Officers Law (POL), certain portions have been redacted for personal privacy and to not reveal criminal investigative techniques or procedures.

Pursuant to POL §89(4)(a), you may appeal this determination within 30 days to the Counsel, Division of Criminal Justice Services, 80 South Swan St., Albany, NY 12210 or by email at foil@dcjs.ny.gov.

Very truly yours,

Brian Garvey, Esq.
Records Access Officer

Here's the attachments as a link for your review:
Schenectady County GIVE 2019-2024_Redacted.pdf<https://acrobat.adobe.com/id/urn:aaid:sc:VA6C2:3ed5463f-0796-49ea-8718-b9813856281e>

Schenectady PD_Redacted.pdf<https://acrobat.adobe.com/id/urn:aaid:sc:VA6C2:b1035485-1ed1-46ab-a376-c5596e56ee43>
Add your comments and collaborate with others in real time. You don't need to download Acrobat or sign up to access the file.

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Fort Lauderdale ShotSpotter Contract
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

The most recent contract (i.e. council resolution, contract extension, contract amendments, cure notices, or other revisions to agreements) between the city and SoundThinking, Inc., formerly ShotSpotter, Inc.. This document(s) should include the total cost over the life of the contract and the current expiration date.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Sophia Ludt

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Luigi Mangione
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All Advisories, Suspicious Activity Reports, Tips, Intelligence Briefs, Intel Reports, Leads Information or Data, Maps, Bulletins, BOLOs, and/or Joint Bulletins from 1 December 2024 to the date this request is processed (inclusive) regarding "Luigi Mangione".

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Petti

communications.subject: Public Records Request :: R002875-022625
communications.communication:
Dear Matthew Petti: 
 
Thank you for your interest in public records of the Washington State Patrol. Your request has been received and is being processed in accordance with the Revised Code of Washington, RCW 42.56. Your request was received in this office on 2/26/2025 and given the reference number R002875-022625 for tracking purposes. 
Records Requested: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All Advisories, Suspicious Activity Reports, Tips, Intelligence Briefs, Intel Reports, Leads Information or Data, Maps, Bulletins, BOLOs, and/or Joint Bulletins from 1 December 2024 to the date this request is processed (inclusive) regarding "Luigi Mangione".

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Petti

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Ffusion-center-6083%252Fluigi-mangione-182120%252F%253Femail%253Dwafusion%252540wsp.wa.gov&url_auth_token=AAAWdcappnvapfcJdDXM-mFEnCw%3A1tnTRf%3AKha1tV9-g_doYDebISdxZFxtPvxEl0DUItWIepGmhsM 
 
Your request will be forwarded to the relevant Washington State Patrol department(s) to locate the information you seek and to determine the volume and any costs associated with satisfying your request. You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records in question. PLEASE NOTE: The Washington Public Records Act does not require a governmental body to create new information, to do legal research, or to answer questions. 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the Public Records Center. 
Washington State Patrol

RE: Public Records Request of February 26, 2025, Reference # R002875-022625 Dear Matthew Petti, The Washington State Patrol has received yourpublic disclosure request regarding: “To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 

All Advisories, Suspicious Activity Reports, Tips, Intelligence Briefs, Intel Reports, Leads Information or Data, Maps, Bulletins, BOLOs, and/or Joint Bulletins from 1 December 2024 to the date this request is processed (inclusive) regarding "Luigi Mangione". 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Matthew Petti 

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Ffusion-center-6083%252Fluigi-mangione-182120%252F%253Femail%253Dwafusion%252540wsp.wa.gov&url_auth_token=AAAWdcappnvapfcJdDXM-mFEnCw%3A1tnTRf%3AKha1tV9-g_doYDebISdxZFxtPvxEl0DUItWIepGmhsM” Pursuant to RCW 42.56.520, this is notification that we are searching our records to determine the location, nature, and amount of records, if any, that may be responsive to your request.  If responsive records are found, we estimate that we can make available an installment of records on or before 5/15/2025.  If records are ready prior to that time, you will be notified.  If the time assessment requires adjustment, you will also be notified. Should you have any questions, please let us know. Sincerely, Gabby Anderson, Forms and Records Analyst 3

title: Fort Worth Police Department NYC trip receipts | Sally Mann

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Fort Worth Police Department NYC trip receipts | Sally Mann
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1) All receipts incurred for FWPD's trip to New York City in its investigation of the Modern Art Museum of Fort Worth.

According to a 4/28/25/ Fort Worth Report story, trip expenses included $2,506.92 for the officers’ lodging, $1,694.85 for airfare, $47 for parking at DFW Airport, $670 for museum entry fees, and $2,070 per diem. I am requesting copies of the receipts that constituted these expenses.

2) FWPD's most recent policy protocol on work travel expenses. (Per a  4/28/25 Fort Worth Report story, a spokesperson said "Trip expenses were covered following our policy protocols").

If you determine that some but not all the information we’ve requested is exempt from disclosure and that you intend to withhold it, I ask that you redact it for the time being and make the rest available on a rolling basis. In any event, please provide a signed notification citing the legal authorities on which you rely if you determine that any information is exempt and will not be disclosed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge and processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage, and therefore we request that you waive any costs.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I also ask that our request be filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available (email: bdavis@star-telegram.com) – if not, secure file transfer, thumb drive, or CD-ROM. 

Sincerely,

Bradford Davis

communications.subject: Police Open Records Request :: P008608-042825
communications.communication:
Dear Bradford  Davis: 
 Thank you for your interest in public records of the City of Fort Worth, Texas. Your request has been received and is being processed in accordance with Chapter 552 of Texas Government Code, the Public Information Act. Your request was received in this office and given the log number P008608-042825 for tracking purposes. 
Your request will be forwarded to the relevant City department(s) to locate the information you seek and to determine the volume and any costs associated with satisfying your request. You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records in question. PLEASE NOTE: Texas Public Information Act does not require a governmental body to create new information, to do legal research, or to answer questions. 

 Public Information Administrator 
 
 This is an auto-generated email and has originated from an unmonitored email account. Please DO NOT REPLY

communications.subject: P008608 Bradford Davis
communications.communication:
[full-color logo]


05/12/2025

Bradford Davis
MuckRock News, Dept MR 185711
263 Huntington Ave.

Boston, MA 02115

RE: Public Information Request P008608-042825

Dear Bradford Davis,

This letter responds to your request for information to the City of Fort Worth, dated and received in our office on 04/28/2025.


Information Requested: Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1) All receipts incurred for FWPD's trip to New York City in its investigation of the Modern Art Museum of Fort Worth.

According to a 4/28/25/ Fort Worth Report story, trip expenses included $2,506.92 for the officers' lodging, $1,694.85 for airfare, $47 for parking at DFW Airport, $670 for museum entry fees, and $2,070 per diem. I am requesting copies of the receipts that constituted these expenses.

2) FWPD's most recent policy protocol on work travel expenses. (Per a 4/28/25 Fort Worth Report story, a spokesperson said "Trip expenses were covered following our policy protocols").

If you determine that some but not all the information we've requested is exempt from disclosure and that you intend to withhold it, I ask that you redact it for the time being and make the rest available on a rolling basis. In any event, please provide a signed notification citing the legal authorities on which you rely if you determine that any information is exempt and will not be disclosed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge and processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage, and therefore we request that you waive any costs.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I also ask that our request be filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available (email: bdavis@star-telegram.com) - if not, secure file transfer, thumb drive, or CD-ROM.

The City of Fort Worth has reviewed its files and has located the enclosed documents that are responsive to your request. Although the Public Information Act allows a governmental body to charge for copying documents, the enclosed is being provided to you at no charge.
The City has redacted dates of birth in accordance with a previous determination granted to the City by the Attorney General in OR2016-00620. The City has redacted the social security number of a living person in accordance with Government Code 552.147.  The City has redacted motor vehicle records in accordance with the exclusions you agreed to when you submitted your request.  The City has redacted account numbers and financial information in accordance with the exclusions you agreed to when you submitted your request. The City has redacted officer personnel information in accordance to the exclusions you agreed to when you submitted your request.



If you have any questions, or wish to discuss this further, you may contact me at (817) 392-4283.

Sincerely,

Rocio Anguiano
Public Information Specialist
Internal Affairs/ Open Records Unit
505 W. Felix St.
Fort Worth, TX 76115
Phone: 817-392-4283
Rocio.Anguiano@fortworthtexas.gov<mailto:Rocio.Anguiano@fortworthtexas.gov>

title: Library Contract Request: Elsevier ScienceDirect at Winston Salem State University

communications.subject: North Carolina Public Records Law Request: Library Contract Request: Elsevier ScienceDirect at Winston Salem State University
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the North Carolina Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

1) The most recent contract, governing, base, or master license agreement with Elsevier, a subsidiary of RELX, relating to the product ScienceDirect;

2) All related terms and conditions, terms of service, amendments, addenda, appendices, attachments, product terms, MOUs, MOAs, data processing agreements, and/or letters of intent; and

3) All financial documents or records of financial transactions, exchanges or obligations related to contractual relations with Elsevier for ScienceDirect. 

Please do not limit your search to strictly direct agreements or renewals between the institution and Elsevier, but include all agreements and related documentation through consortia such as the Carolina Consortium or Lyrasis.

Responsive materials include all contracts, agreements, amendments, appendices, invoices, and any other documents listed above that incorporate language governing terms of use of ScienceDirect.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Ellen Dubinsky

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL] Public Records Requests [#95]
communications.communication:

Thank you.

Pursuant to the Arizona Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

1. A copy of any policy concerning recognition or registration of student organizations at your institution or at any institution within your district.

2. A copy of any list of active or recognized student organizations at your institution or at any institution within your district.

3. A copy of any list of contact information for active or recognized student organizations at your institution or at any institution within your district.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

communications.subject: ORR 3151 Confirmation Receipt of Your Request for Information
communications.communication:
Please accept this as confirmation of your request for information as
allowable by the Office of the Attorney General of the State of Texas.  We
will contact you if we require clarification from you before fulfilling
your request. Should ACC need additional time to comply with your request,
you will receive notice of the reason for the delay and an approximate date
the information shall become available.
Pursuant to Section 552.261 of the Texas Public Information Act, the
district will charge 10 cents per page for copies or charge for time and
labor for programming or gathering the information that you've requested at
$15 per hour.  If your request exceeds $40, you will be provided a detailed
cost estimate.  You must respond in writing within 10 days after the
estimate is sent that you will accept the costs, or that you desire any
stated alternative, or your request will be considered withdrawn. Payment
can be made online at ACC Marketplace after your estimate is provided.

If the estimated charge is more than $100.00, the College may ask for a
prepaid deposit before providing the information.

You may ask the College to determine whether providing the information
primarily benefits the general public, resulting in a waiver or reduction
of charges.

Your request has been logged and will be tracked as ORR 3151.

Please contact me if you have any questions about this information.

Thank you,


Dahlia Anzaldua-Torres
Office of College Relations & Marketing
austincc.edu
512-223-7595

ACC Highland Campus
6101 Highland Campus Drive
Austin, Texas 78752

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Untitled (Tampa Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Data on crime incidents—those classified by your agency as crimes—rather than calls for service or unfounded incidents:
•	Year(s) Requested: 2009; 2011; 2013; 2015; 2018
•	Columns Requested: Incident date, Incident time, Type of crime (e.g., robbery, theft, etc.), Incident ID, and All other available columns that do not require additional processing by the agency or redaction.

If the data are stored in a proprietary or custom electronic format not publicly available, I request that it be converted to a format viewable with standard software, such as Microsoft Excel or CSV. Please avoid providing data in PDF or paper printouts.

This request is made to support academic research conducted in the public interest and is not for commercial purposes. The data will contribute to a research project assessing the effect of music concerts on crime, aiming to enhance public understanding of how large events influence community safety.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Kristina Block

communications.subject: TPD Records Requests :: R112306-013125
communications.communication:
Dear Kristina Block: 
The City is in receipt of the below public records request and it will be forwarded to the appropriate department(s) for a response to determine if such a record(s) exists. All City records are open for personal inspection and copying by any person except for portions of records which contain exempt or confidential information which may not be disclosed unless otherwise permitted by law.  While the City strives to provide access to public records by remote electronic means, it is necessary that the records are reviewed for possible exempt or confidential information prior to disclosure.  Should the records contain exempt or confidential information that is required to be redacted, the City will need to bill for the time expended on making the necessary redactions.  Should any extraordinary time be required, the City charges administrative fees as authorized by Florida Statutes.  An estimate of charges will be provided for prepayment prior to work being processed. 
Records Requested: "[PUBLICRECORDDESIRED]" 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the City of Tampa Public Records Center. 
City of Tampa

title: Request for Body Cam Footage of Arrest and Interrogation

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Request for Body Cam Footage of Arrest and Interrogation
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:

Date: December 11, 2024
Location: Miami Beach, FL
Suspects: Alon Alexander, Oren Alexander
Incident Summary: The Alexander brothers were arrested by Miami Beach Police as part of a multi-state investigation into alleged sex trafficking and sexual assault. The bodycam footage reportedly captures their arrest and subsequent interrogations, with Oren Alexander being transported to a police vehicle before questioning began approximately 10 minutes later. A similar interrogation took place with Alon Alexander in a separate room. The total footage reportedly lasts nearly two hours.
I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who:

Participated in the arrests of Alon and Oren Alexander.
Transported the suspects.
Conducted or were present during their interrogations.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Harun
